projectDesc.p: To the Tune “Qingping Music”—"The Golden Wind" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg:
The gold wind
The Autumn wind
is gentle and tender,
The leaves of the parasol tree fall one by one.

The first taste of the green wine
fine wine
easily makes one tipsy.
Lying by the window, I sleep soundly.
The crepe-myrtle and hibiscus have withered,
But the slanting sun still shines on the railing.
It is the time when swallows are about to depart in pairs;

Last night it was slightly cold behind the silver screen
Refers to a protective screen that separates the girls’ room to the living room, where only men are allowed.
